data.question: What is the total gravimetric H2 uptake of FJI-H5 at 77 K and 90 bar?
What is the BET surface area of FJI-H5?
What is the total CH4 uptake of FJI-H5 at 298 K and 35 bar?
What is the crystal system of FJI-H5?
What is the space group of FJI-H5?
What is the empirical formula of FJI-H5?
What is the role of the Cu2 SBUs in FJI-H5?
data.answer: They are used to construct the framework and contribute to the high H2 uptake due to the alignment of open copper sites.

data.question: Why does FJI-H5 have a high surface area?
data.answer: Due to the design of the semi-rigid bent di-isophthalate ligand and the construction of the framework with Cu2 SBUs.

data.question: How does the symmetry of ligands affect the construction of MOFs?
data.answer: Reducing the symmetry of the ligands leads to the construction of diversified MOFs with uncommon topologies and high gas uptakes.

data.question: What is the significance of the coexistence of cages and one-dimensional channels in FJI-H5?
data.answer: It contributes to the high gas uptake and storage capabilities of the MOF.

data.question: How does the extension of the arms of the bent ligands affect the MOF?
data.answer: It results in a higher surface area and better performance for H2 and CH4 uptakes.

data.question: What is the relationship between the surface area of MOFs and H2 uptake at high pressure?
data.answer: At high pressure, the H2 uptake at 77 K has a qualitative linear relationship with the surface area.

data.question: Is FJI-H5 crystalline after activation?
Does FJI-H5 have a higher H2 uptake than PCN-12?
Is the total pore volume of FJI-H5 among the highest values reported for MOFs?
Is the isosteric heat of H2 adsorption for FJI-H5 lower than 5 kJ mol-1?
Does FJI-H5 have a lower BET surface area than PCN-12?
Is the solvent accessible volume in fully desolvated FJI-H5 less than 50%?
Does FJI-H5 use H4mdip ligands in its construction?
Is the crystal system of FJI-H5 cubic?
